instructions.instruction: Create tracking-database.json with empty config, talks, pptx_catalog, and confirmed_intents arrays if the file is missing
instructions.original_snippets: Read `tracking-database.json` (create with empty `config`, `talks`, `pptx_catalog` if missing).
instructions.relevant_when: Initializing a new vault or starting work on a vault that has no tracking database

instructions.instruction: Tracking database config must contain specific fields: vault_root, talks_source_dir, pptx_source_dir, python_path, template_skip_patterns
instructions.original_snippets: Config field | Question | Auto-detect ... vault_root ... talks_source_dir ... pptx_source_dir ... python_path ... template_skip_patterns
instructions.relevant_when: Creating or validating the tracking database schema

instructions.instruction: Scan for new talks by globbing *.md in talks_source_dir, parse each for title, conference, date, URLs, IDs, and add with status 'pending'
instructions.original_snippets: Scan for new talks: Glob `*.md` in `talks_source_dir`. For each file not in the `talks` array, parse and add (extract title, conference, date, URLs, IDs, status `"pending"`).
instructions.relevant_when: Discovering talk metadata files and building the talks array

instructions.instruction: Scan for .pptx files using recursive glob **/*.pptx in pptx_source_dir
instructions.original_snippets: Scan for .pptx files: Glob `**/*.pptx` in `pptx_source_dir`.
instructions.relevant_when: Cataloging presentation files for matching to talks

instructions.instruction: Skip .pptx files named *static*, *(N).pptx (conflict copies), or matching template_skip_patterns
instructions.original_snippets: Skip files named `*static*`, `*(N).pptx` (conflict copies), or matching `template_skip_patterns`. ... PPTX files named `*static*` or `*(N).pptx` are always skipped.
instructions.relevant_when: Scanning .pptx files for cataloging or extraction

instructions.instruction: Fuzzy-match .pptx files to talks by conference name and title, flagging ambiguous matches for user confirmation
instructions.original_snippets: Fuzzy-match each to a `talks[]` entry by conference + title. ... 1. Normalize conference names (strip year, 'Days', 'Conference', etc.) 2. Match by date proximity 3. Match by title substring 4. Flag ambiguous matches
instructions.relevant_when: Associating .pptx files with talk entries in the tracking database

instructions.instruction: Determine slide_source as 'pptx' if only pptx_path, 'pdf' if only slides_url, 'both' if both exist
instructions.original_snippets: Set `slide_source` on each processable talk: `"pptx"` if only `pptx_path`, `"pdf"` if only `slides_url`, `"both"` if both exist.
instructions.relevant_when: Determining how to acquire slide data for a talk

instructions.instruction: Mark talks missing video_url or missing BOTH slides_url and pptx_path as 'skipped_no_sources'
instructions.original_snippets: Talks missing `video_url` or missing BOTH `slides_url` and `pptx_path`: mark `"skipped_no_sources"`, skip.
instructions.relevant_when: Filtering processable vs non-processable talks

instructions.instruction: Use yt-dlp with specific flags: --write-auto-sub --sub-lang en --skip-download --sub-format vtt
instructions.original_snippets: yt-dlp --write-auto-sub --sub-lang en --skip-download --sub-format vtt -o "{vault_root}/transcripts/{youtube_id}" "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v={youtube_id}"
instructions.relevant_when: Downloading YouTube transcripts for talk analysis

instructions.instruction: Clean VTT files: strip timestamp lines (\d{2}:\d{2}.*-->), strip cue position markers (align:start position:%), remove blank lines, deduplicate consecutive identical lines, save as .txt
instructions.original_snippets: 1. Strip all timestamp lines (lines matching `\d{2}:\d{2}.*-->`) 2. Strip cue position markers (lines like `align:start position:0%`) 3. Remove blank lines 4. Deduplicate consecutive identical lines 5. Save the cleaned text as `{vault_root}/transcripts/{youtube_id}.txt`
instructions.relevant_when: Processing VTT subtitle files into clean transcript text

instructions.instruction: Use youtube-transcript-api as fallback if yt-dlp fails
instructions.original_snippets: Use if yt-dlp fails (e.g., no auto-captions available): ... from youtube_transcript_api import YouTubeTranscriptApi
instructions.relevant_when: When primary transcript download method fails

instructions.instruction: Use gdown for Google Drive PDF slide downloads with specific command format
instructions.original_snippets: "{python_path}" -m gdown "https://drive.google.com/uc?id={google_drive_id}" -O "{vault_root}/slides/{google_drive_id}.pdf"
instructions.relevant_when: Downloading slide PDFs from Google Drive

instructions.instruction: Use the specific python-pptx extraction script from pptx-extraction.md for PPTX visual data extraction
instructions.original_snippets: Run the PPTX extraction script from `references/pptx-extraction.md` inline. This provides exact hex colors, font names, layout names, and shape types
instructions.relevant_when: Extracting visual design data from .pptx files

instructions.instruction: PPTX extraction must output JSON with per_slide_visual array and global_design object containing fonts_used, background_colors, shape_types_used, and color_sequence
instructions.original_snippets: result = { "pptx_path": pptx_path, "slide_count": len(prs.slides), ... "per_slide_visual": [], "global_design": { "fonts_used": Counter(), "background_colors": Counter(), "shape_types_used": Counter(), "color_sequence": [] } }
instructions.relevant_when: Producing PPTX extraction output

instructions.instruction: Extract background color using slide.background.fill first, falling back to slide_layout.background.fill
instructions.original_snippets: def get_background_color(slide): ... bg = slide.background ... # Fall back to slide layout background ... layout_bg = slide.slide_layout.background.fill
instructions.relevant_when: Extracting background colors from PowerPoint slides

instructions.instruction: Detect footer text by position: text shapes in the bottom 15% of the slide (shape.top > slide_height * 0.85)
instructions.original_snippets: # Detect footer by position (bottom 15% of slide) and small font ... if shape.top and shape.top > prs.slide_height * 0.85: slide_data["footer_text"] = shape.text_frame.text
instructions.relevant_when: Identifying footer elements in PPTX slides

instructions.instruction: Analyze all 14 rhetoric dimensions from rhetoric-dimensions.md, including dimension 14 (Areas for Improvement)
instructions.original_snippets: Apply all 14 dimensions from `references/rhetoric-dimensions.md` (including dimension 14: Areas for Improvement).
instructions.relevant_when: Analyzing a talk for rhetoric and style patterns

instructions.instruction: Per-slide visual classification must include: background color name, content type, image composition, speech bubble present, starburst present, footer visible
instructions.original_snippets: For EACH slide, determine: Background color name ... Content type ... Image composition ... Speech bubble present? ... Starburst/explosion shape present? ... Footer visible?
instructions.relevant_when: Classifying slide visual elements during talk analysis

instructions.instruction: Record background_color_sequence for every slide in order
instructions.original_snippets: Record the background color of every slide in order as `background_color_sequence`.
instructions.relevant_when: Tracking slide color patterns across a talk

instructions.instruction: Extract structured_data with specific fields: slide_count, talk_duration_estimate, meme_count, image_only_slide_count, audience_interaction_count, opening_type, closing_type, narrative_arc_type, slide_design_style, opening_sequence, closing_sequence
instructions.original_snippets: Count and categorize these for the `structured_data` output: slide_count ... talk_duration_estimate ... meme_count ... image_only_slide_count ... audience_interaction_count ... opening_type ... closing_type ... narrative_arc_type ... slide_design_style ... opening_sequence ... closing_sequence
instructions.relevant_when: Producing structured analysis output for a talk

instructions.instruction: Extract verbatim_examples with fields: signature_phrases, jokes, transitions, audience_addresses, opening_lines, closing_lines
instructions.original_snippets: Extract ACTUAL QUOTES from the transcript for the `verbatim_examples` output: signature_phrases ... jokes ... transitions ... audience_addresses ... opening_lines ... closing_lines
instructions.relevant_when: Extracting verbatim quotes from talk transcripts

instructions.instruction: Subagent return JSON must follow the schema: filename, rhetoric_notes (500-1000 words), areas_for_improvement (100-300 words), structured_data, verbatim_examples, adherence_assessment, new_patterns, summary_updates
instructions.original_snippets: { "filename": "the .md filename", "rhetoric_notes": "500-1000 words", "areas_for_improvement": "100-300 words", "structured_data": {...}, "verbatim_examples": {...}, "adherence_assessment": "...", "new_patterns": "...", "summary_updates": "..." }
instructions.relevant_when: Producing the output of a talk analysis subagent

instructions.instruction: Error handling matrix: transcript OK + slides OK → 'processed'; transcript FAIL + slides OK → 'processed_partial'; transcript OK + slides FAIL → 'processed_partial'; both FAIL → 'skipped_download_failed'
instructions.original_snippets: Transcript | Slides | Status | Action ... OK | OK | processed | Full analysis ... FAIL | OK | processed_partial | Slides only ... OK | FAIL | processed_partial | Transcript only ... FAIL | FAIL | skipped_download_failed | Skip, move on
instructions.relevant_when: Setting status after processing a talk with download failures

instructions.instruction: Summary updates must be additive — refine and consolidate but never delete existing content
instructions.original_snippets: Be additive; refine and consolidate but never delete. ... Preserve all summary content — add/refine, never delete.
instructions.relevant_when: Updating the rhetoric-style-summary.md document

instructions.instruction: Summary sections map to profile fields: Section 1→presentation_modes, Sections 2-13→instrument_catalog, Section 15→recurring_issues, Section 16→confirmed_intents + rhetoric_defaults
instructions.original_snippets: Section 1: Presentation modes (→ profile `presentation_modes`) ... Sections 2-13: Instrument catalogs (→ profile `instrument_catalog`) ... Section 15: Areas for improvement (→ profile `guardrail_sources.recurring_issues`) ... Section 16: Speaker-confirmed intent (→ profile `confirmed_intents` + `rhetoric_defaults`)
instructions.relevant_when: Mapping rhetoric summary sections to speaker profile fields

instructions.instruction: Confirmed intents stored as JSON objects with fields: pattern, intent (deliberate|accidental|context_dependent), rule, note
instructions.original_snippets: {"pattern": "delayed_self_introduction", "intent": "deliberate", "rule": "Two-phase intro: brief bio slide 3, full re-intro mid-talk", "note": "Confirmed intentional rhetorical device"}
instructions.relevant_when: Recording speaker-confirmed design decisions

instructions.instruction: Generate speaker profile only after 10+ talks parsed AND one clarification session completed

instructions.original_snippets: Generate `speaker-profile.json` per `references/speaker-profile-schema.md`: speaker ← config fields ... infrastructure ← config + template layouts ... presentation_modes ... design_rules ... rhetoric_defaults ... confirmed_intents ... pacing ... guardrail_sources ... instrument_catalog ... publishing_process
instructions.relevant_when: Generating or validating the speaker profile JSON

instructions.instruction: Speaker profile must include schema_version: 1
instructions.original_snippets: "schema_version": 1

instructions.instruction: Generate speaker badges — personalized, fun, self-deprecating achievements grounded in real vault data
instructions.original_snippets: Generate speaker badges — mine the aggregated data for ridiculous achievements, milestones, and self-aware honors. Add as `badges` section in the profile. ... Badges should be genuinely personalized to THIS speaker's quirks, not generic. Make them fun, self-deprecating, and grounded in real vault data.

instructions.original_snippets: Re-read tracking DB before writing (single source of truth).

instructions.instruction: Process talks in parallel batches of 5 subagents

instructions.original_snippets: Load order — read all three from vault root: ... summary: rhetoric-style-summary.md ... design: slide-design-spec.md ... profile: speaker-profile.json

instructions.original_snippets: If profile doesn't exist (vault has <10 talks), run in summary-only mode: ... Phase 4: Guardrails | Default thresholds: 1.5 slides/min, 45% Act 1 cap, three-part close

instructions.instruction: Do not skip phases. Do not write content before Phase 3. Phase 2 is joint, not autonomous.

instructions.original_snippets: PRESENTATION SPEC ... Title: ... Thesis: ... Audience: ... Venue: ... Mode: ... Commercial intent: ... Must-include: ... Must-avoid: ... Co-presenter: ... Profanity register: ... Duration target: ... Shownotes slug:

instructions.instruction: Outline format: ## sections with [N min, slides X-Y] time and slide range annotations
instructions.original_snippets: ## Opening Sequence [3 min, slides 1-5] ... ## Act 1: [Title] [N min, slides X-Y]
instructions.relevant_when: Writing the presentation outline

instructions.instruction: Use typed, independently-numbered placeholders: [AUTHOR 01], [DEMO 01], [DATA 01], [SCREENSHOT 01], [MEME 01]
instructions.original_snippets: Placeholders use typed, independent numbering: `[AUTHOR 01]`, `[DEMO 01]`, `[DATA 01]`, `[SCREENSHOT 01]`, `[MEME 01]` ... Each type uses independent numbering.
instructions.relevant_when: Writing placeholder content in the outline

instructions.instruction: Meme briefs must include: Template name, Search query, Overlay text, Rhetorical function
instructions.original_snippets: [MEME 01] Template: [meme template name] Search query: "[search terms]" Overlay text: [specific text] Rhetorical function: [what argument this meme serves]

instructions.instruction: Mark callbacks explicitly: [CALLBACK: reference to {element} from slide {N}], [PROGRESSIVE LIST: ...], [RUNNING GAG: Nth appearance of {gag}]
instructions.original_snippets: [CALLBACK: reference to {element} from slide {N} — {variation}] [PROGRESSIVE LIST: {list name} gains Nth item from slide {N}] [RUNNING GAG: Nth appearance of {gag}]

instructions.original_snippets: ## [CUT LINE: Everything below here can be dropped for short version] ... [CUT LINE] markers for shorter slot adaptation ... [EXPAND ZONE] markers for sections that can grow

instructions.instruction: Opening sequence should include title slide, opening hook, brief bio, shownotes URL
instructions.original_snippets: ### Slide 1: Title Slide ... ### Slide 2: [Opening hook type] ... ### Slide 3: Brief Bio ... ### Slide 4: Shownotes URL
instructions.relevant_when: Structuring the opening of a presentation outline

instructions.instruction: Three-part close: summary (2-3 bullet points), CTA (specific actionable step), social (handles + shownotes URL)
instructions.original_snippets: Summary: At least 2-3 bullet points crystallizing the argument ... CTA: At least one specific, actionable next step ... Social: Speaker handles + shownotes URL
instructions.relevant_when: Structuring the closing sequence of a presentation

instructions.instruction: For co-presented talks, use [SPEAKER A]: / [SPEAKER B]: prefixes in all speaker notes

instructions.original_snippets: If co-presented, add: ... Footer Adaptation (`design_rules.footer.co_presented_extra`)
instructions.relevant_when: Handling branding for co-presented talks

instructions.instruction: Run all 9 guardrail checks: slide budget, Act 1 ratio, branding, profanity, data attribution, time-sensitive content, closing completeness, cut lines, anti-pattern flags
instructions.original_snippets: [PASS/FAIL] Slide budget ... [PASS/WARN] Act 1 ratio ... [PASS/FAIL] Branding ... [PASS/FAIL] Profanity ... [PASS/FAIL] Data attribution ... [PASS/FAIL] Time-sensitive ... [PASS/FAIL] Closing ... [PASS/FAIL] Cut lines ... [INFO] Anti-patterns
instructions.relevant_when: Running quality checks on a presentation outline

instructions.instruction: Guardrail report uses format: GUARDRAIL CHECK — {title} with [PASS/FAIL/WARN] prefix per check
instructions.original_snippets: GUARDRAIL CHECK — {talk title} — {date} ================================================ [PASS] Slide budget: {actual}/{max} ...

instructions.instruction: Act 1 ratio limits from profile: 20-30min→40%, 45min→45%, 60+min→50%
instructions.original_snippets: act1_ratio_limits: [{"duration_range": "20-30 min", "max_percent": 40}, {"duration_range": "45 min", "max_percent": 45}, {"duration_range": "60+ min", "max_percent": 50}]

instructions.instruction: On-slide profanity should be verbal-only by default — flag any baked-in profanity for approval
instructions.original_snippets: keep profanity verbal-only by default. On-slide profanity limits deck reuse across venues. ... If on-slide profanity is present without explicit approval, flag it
